content.description: Climb a steep, technical face to a ledge. Power up a corner, which is followed by several big moves to a just adequate shakeout below the technical crux at a roof. Be warned, there is a final difficult move guarding the chains that can be a real heartbreaker.
content.location: Starts just to the right of Big Science

content.description: The most difficult route in the amphitheater to date. It is a long endurance pitch that can be divided into four distinct sections. The opening section (5.10) is on gear with one bolt--bring a couple micro cams. The next three sections are sport bolted. Each of these sections has a distinct crux followed by continuously difficult climbing. There are stances that can be milked for rests below all of the upper cruxes.
content.location: The route starts on the face with the crack just to the left of Big Science and before the 3rd-class move to the Upper Tier.

content.description: Climb the steep face to a ledge under the crux roof (V4/5). Once over the roof it is fun, super steep climbing on big holds to the chains.
content.location: This is the left of the 2 routes that starts on the ledge under the huge overhang face caped by a visor.
